turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new running shoes. I usually run about 5 miles, three times a week. Any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Based on your running frequency and distance, I would recommend looking at shoes with good cushioning and support. Some popular models include the Brooks Ghost, the ASICS Gel-Kayano, and the New Balance Fresh Foam series. Would you like me to filter the recommendations by price range or any specific features?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, those all seem pretty generic recommendations. I have slightly pronated feet and I've had issues with plantar fasciitis in the past. Do you have anything that addresses those specific needs? It's really frustrating when I buy shoes and they just don't work out!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. For pronation and plantar fasciitis, I would strongly suggest the ASICS Gel-Kayano, which is known for its stability. Also, look at shoes from brands like Saucony or Hoka, which may offer models specifically designed for these conditions. Unfortunately, I can't guarantee a perfect fit, but I can show you products with those characteristics. I'll narrow the search based on these requirements. Would you like me to add a filter based on your preferred color scheme?
